https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/372410Federal Territories Youth chief Khairil Nizam Khairudin today lambasted those unearthing claims that PAS spiritual leader Hashim Jasin owns a Porsche Cayman car, in light of the RM90 million controversy.Car ownership information showing that Hashim owns the luxury car has been circulating online after Hashim said he would not be driving a Proton Saga if PAS had RM90 million."The car has nothing to do with the RM90 million claim."RM90 million is a lot of money. If we had in fact received RM90 million we would use to uphold Islam and help the rakyat, not buy cars," said Khairil Nizam.Quote[U]"I had already explained that the car belongs to my son, who bought it in England last year (2012) at a cost of about RM100,000" "We at PAS Federal Territories believe there was never a RM90 million contribution to any of our leaders"

"In this context", I would like to make an assumption....just an assumption, remember that word - "assumption" that the "context" was based on your perception and understanding of the article written by the reporter. Yeah, a kid can indeed interpret, even a senile old grandma can but whether it is accurate or not is a fucking different story~ So, what the reporter did was to publish what she interpret out of the interview, not exactly what had been said by the interviewee. You do realize that in a case of a defamation suit, every word uttered will be taken into account and scrutinized thoroughly not only contextually, but literally and textually as well. #PeterBandermann hates spinning journalism~

no, car is under his (hashim jasin) name.actually all MP can get free 1 AP to buy a car overseas for their use (as many here had already explained)some MP sell the AP to other ppl and use proceeds for their constituency.I know tian chua bought a Mercedes with his AP (plate number was 8308) but later sold it to fund his pusat khidmat parlimen in jln sentul...problem now is that this issue raised again bcos husam musa (ex-pas) claimed PAS (specifically hadi's faction in PAS) received RM90mil. from najib.so some ppl claimed part of that money went to hashim jasin when it was found out that there's a Porsche registered under his name.

1. not illegal to purchase a car using someone elses' name in your example.2. yes it's unethical bcos you used loophole.3. and yes, sprm can investigate since it's a suspicious transaction, but most probably won't get any charges, just some hassle...unless you purchased a lot of cars (like say using your son's friends' AP quota if they allow it) and you resell them back to get quick profit...then becomes LHDN issue...
